Fiber slows down sugar absorption, preventing sudden spikes in blood glucose levels and reducing the risk of type 2 diabetes.

Her farewell note, which she wrote five months before her death, has now gone viral. Murphy was diagnosed with Bulbar ALS, a neurodegenerative disease
content: In a rare and poignant act, Linda Murphy, a Massachusetts woman, wrote her own obituary—full of humour and grace—before passing away on September 21. Her farewell note, which she wrote five months before her death, has now gone viral. Murphy was diagnosed with Bulbar ALS, a neurodegenerative disease, in 2022. Bulbar ALS, also known as bulbar-onset amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, is a subtype of ALS, a progressive neurological disorder that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.

content: The number of students confirmed dead after the collapse of an Islamic school building in Indonesia rose to 13 late on Friday, the country's disaster mitigation agency said, as the search for survivors continued. The Al Khoziny school in the town of Sidoarjo in East Java province caved in on Monday, cratering upon hundreds of teenage students during afternoon prayer, its foundations unable to support ongoing construction work on its upper floors. Thirty ambulances were prepared as rescuers conti...

content: A Tricolor dealership in Phoenix. title: Goldman's Solomon Expects US Economy to Accelerate
description: David Solomon expects the US economy to accelerate into 2026 due to tailwinds from continued stimulus and tech spending. The Goldman Sachs Group Inc. CEO said the economy was "still in pretty good shape" despite the impact of tariffs and a slower US job market.
content: David Solomon expects the US economy to accelerate into 2026 due to tailwinds from continued stimulus and tech spending. The Goldman Sachs Group Inc. CEO said the economy was "still in pretty good shape" despite the impact of tariffs and a slower US job market. title: LOreal India posts 22.6 pc rise in profit to  ₹597.5 cr in FY25 | Company Business News
description: New Delhi, Oct 3 (PTI) Cosmetic major L'Oréal India's profit in FY25 increased 22.6 per cent to ₹597.54 crore, while its net sales were up 6.25 per cent to ₹5,925.33 crore, the company said in an RoC filing. Its total income, which includes other income, was also up 5.2 per cent to ₹5,979.16 crore f
content: New Delhi, Oct 3 (PTI) Cosmetic major L'Oréal India's profit in FY25 increased 22.6 per cent to ₹597.54 crore, while its net sales were up 6.25 per cent to ₹5,925.33 crore, the company said in an RoC filing. Its total income, which includes other income, was also up 5.2 per cent to ₹5,979.16 crore for the financial year ended March 31, 2025. L'Oréal India Pvt Ltd had reported a profit of 487.46 crore and its revenue from operations -- which is income from net sales -- was ₹5,576.47 crore in FY24...

content: (Bloomberg) -- Emerging-market currencies are on track for a modest weekly gain, as the absence of US data during the government shutdown damped volatility and clouded investors’ reading of the Federal Reserve’s policy path. The MSCI Inc. gauge for developing-nation currencies was little changed as of 1:40 p.m. in New York, with most exchange rates trading in narrow ranges. content: Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran said he’d amend his inflation view if housing costs unexpectedly jumped, conceding that his out-of-consensus opinion isn’t necessarily set in stone. Miran pointed to factors like stricter immigration policies under President Donald Trump and trends in average rent prices that are likely to bring housing inflation down.
